channel.title: 508 Max Level Help
channel.description: What file would i go into to change the max combat from 126 to 138? :]

item.title: 508 Max Level Help
item.dc:creator: @miyu_miyu5 miyu miyu5
item.description:
@miyu_miyu5 wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:5, topic:263108”]Well, if you wanted to use tags correctly, it would look a bit like this -

Go to PlayerUpdateMasks class and find -

p.combatLevel = (int) ((defence + hp + Math.floor(prayer / 2)) * 0.25) + 1;

Change it to -

p.combatLevel = (int) ((defence + hp + Math.floor(prayer / 2) + Math.ceil((summon / 2) + 1)) * 0.25) + 0;

(I edited this line.)

Above that line, add -

int summon = p.getLevelForXP(24);

Miyu Miyu5, do you see how much more organized that looks? (I am not trying to ridicule you; I am only showing you another way to organize your codes. :P)[/quote]srry i did this in the morning b4 going to sschool

Read full topic

item.title: 508 Max Level Help
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Well, if you wanted to use tags correctly, it would look a bit like this -

Go to PlayerUpdateMasks class and find -

p.combatLevel = (int) ((defence + hp + Math.floor(prayer / 2)) * 0.25) + 1;

Change it to -

p.combatLevel = (int) ((defence + hp + Math.floor(prayer / 2) + Math.ceil((summon / 2) + 1)) * 0.25) + 0;

(I edited this line.)

Above that line, add -

int summon = p.getLevelForXP(24);

Miyu Miyu5, do you see how much more organized that looks? (I am not trying to ridicule you; I am only showing you another way to organize your codes. :P)

Read full topic

item.title: 508 Max Level Help
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“miyu miyu5, post:2, topic:263108”]Go to PlayerUpdateMasks.java and find:
Code:

p.combatLevel = (int) ((defence + hp + Math.floor(prayer / 2)) * 0.25)
+ 1;

Change it to:

Code:

 p.combatLevel = (int) ((defence + hp + Math.floor(prayer / 2) + Math.ceil((summon / 2) + 1)) * 0.25) + 0;

(I edited this line)

And above that line add:
Code:

int summon = p.getLevelForXP(24);[/quote]

use code tags.

Read full topic
